description: Octopuses are intelligent cephalopods with eight arms, known for problem-solving and camouflage abilities.
They feed on crustaceans, molluscs and fish and inhabit diverse marine habitats.
The ocelot is a medium-sized wild cat from the Americas with a distinctive spotted coat and nocturnal habits.
They hunt small mammals, birds and reptiles in forested habitats.
Orangutans are great apes native to Borneo and Sumatra, primarily arboreal and frugivorous with high intelligence.
They live in tropical forests and have long lifespans and complex social behaviours.
The osprey is a fish-eating raptor found near water bodies worldwide, noted for its hovering and plunge-diving hunting style.
They nest near coasts, rivers and lakes and feed almost exclusively on fish.
The ostrich is the world's largest bird, flightless and adapted for running with powerful legs and large eyes.
They inhabit open plains and feed on plants and small animals.
